#sidebar TableOfContent
=Introduction=
The basic idea is to transform a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GEDCOM gedcom] database into [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resource_Description_Framework triples or a graph]. That allows flexible queries and reports. 

The fun part is to link these triples with the [http://richard.cyganiak.de/2007/10/lod/ semantic web]. For example connect places with `GeoNames` for maps. Through places you can connect to `dbPedia` and use it as an almanac.

Resources you can cross-query directly together with your own data:
  * http://www.w3.org/wiki/SparqlEndpoints
  * http://labs.mondeca.com/sparqlEndpointsStatus/

=Diagram=
The diagram illustrates how the main classes of the library interact. These main classes can be executed from the command line. If you just want (customized) reports from your own data, you will only need the first two commands: `gedsem.Convert` and `semweb.Select`. Note that HTML output requires an XSL, the example mentioned in [https://code.google.com/p/gedcom2sem/wiki/Localizing#Headers Localize] creates a straightworward table, but you can customize it to render any structure.
